intro: Elynanthus australis, commonly known as the Australian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers. It is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Elynanthus australis is also known for its toxic seeds, which can be harmful if ingested.
